image.altText: M Markika points into the distance as the King follows his gaze.

props.synopsis: Senior Rirratjiŋu elder M Marika, who devoted his life to protecting the natural environment and his people, has died at 64 years old in north-east Arnhem Land.

title.children: Beloved Yolŋu statesman who brushed shoulders with royalty dies aged 64

image.altText: A sign reading Darwin Waterfront

props.synopsis: The Darwin Waterfront Corporation has been cleared of wrongdoing by a Northern Territory parliamentary committee, after the Territory Labor leader raised misuse of public money allegations.

title.children: Claims of made-up NT public job cleared by parliamentary committee

image.altText: A close-up of a man with white hair and glasses looking directly into the camera with a wall behind him

props.synopsis: A man who had "formal" and "informal" arrangements with South Australia's Department for Child Protection to house First Nations children has pleaded not guilty to more than 40 charges including sexual offending against minors.

title.children: Man who worked with SA's child protection department pleads not guilty to child sex offences

image.altText: Aboriginal man, gray hair, in a button up shirt sitting in front of a sign that reads 'Blak Lives Matter' on an Aboriginal flag

props.synopsis: The grandfather of a 24-year-old Aboriginal man who died in police custody in Alice Springs last week has renewed his demands for CCTV vision and an independent probe into the death.

title.children: 'We do not trust police': Continued calls for CCTV in death in custody probe

image.altText: An architectural design shows a terracotta-coloured art gallery standing on a green lawn.

props.synopsis: The long-standing chair of the Museum and Art Gallery of the NT has quit her position, just weeks after an announcement that a planned $150 million Darwin CBD art gallery may not be going ahead.

title.children: Government labels NT art gallery fallout 'a shemozzle' as chair resigns

image.altText: A black plastic bag full of cannabis

props.synopsis: Police say a drug bust that netted 113kg of cannabis and $170,000 in cash has disrupted a sophisticated, cross-border Vietnamese crime gang trafficking large quantities of illegal drugs into the Northern Territory.

title.children: Police say 113kg drug bust 'strikes at the heart' of Vietnamese crime gang

image.altText: An adult cane toad sitting on the ground.

props.synopsis: Milk squeezed from the glands of cane toads could be key to controlling the invasive pests in Australia, with the toxic liquid being used to bait underwater traps.

title.children: How milking cane toad toxin is helping to control the invasive pests

image.altText: Wisam Abo Adwan lies injured in hospital with a white bandage on his neck.

props.synopsis: Palestinian authorities have accused Israeli forces of opening fire on civilians in three attacks in as many days, but the IDF denies shooting civilians.

title.children: Hospitals filling up as UN weighs in on Gaza aid site shootings

image.altText: A crowd of people carrying umbrellas and shopping bags walk along a street on a rainy day.

props.synopsis: Australia's economy grew by 0.2 per cent in the March quarter, and 1.3 per cent through the year, according to the Australian Bureau of Statistics.

title.children: Australia's economic growth slows more than expected

image.altText: Jim Chalmers responds to ABC Leaders Debate, federal election 20

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers has ruled out cutting the tobacco excise despite calls from NSW Premier Chris Minns to review the levy. Follow live.

title.children: Chalmers rules out cutting tobacco excise despite calls from NSW premier

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Liberal candidate for Bradfield says she will 'carefully review' vote counts
Nicolette Boele says Bradfield has 'chosen a new path'
🗳️ Nicolette Boele has won Bradfield by 26 votes.

image.altText: A composite image of a military airfield before and after a drone attack

props.synopsis: Operation Spider's Web saw Ukraine reach deep into Russia and attack some of its most precious war machines. Images showing the damage inflicted are now beginning to emerge.

title.children: Images reveal aircraft lost in Ukraine's 'Spider's Web' attack on Russia

image.altText: A man in a navy uniform behind a desk.

props.synopsis: Australia's Chief of the Defence Force, Admiral David Johnston, says the nation must be prepared for having to launch combat operations from its own soil — a significant shift in military thinking not seen since World War II.

title.children: ADF chief warns Australia must be ready to launch combat operations from home

image.altText: Fungus are being sealed in four plastic bags

props.synopsis: The fungus, classified as a potential agroterrorism weapon, can cause a disease that wipes out crops and leads to liver damage in humans if it gets into food.

title.children: FBI accuses Chinese researchers of smuggling toxic fungus into US

image.altText: A woman and man lie in bed sleeping. The woman is using a CPAP machine.

props.synopsis: Multinational tech giant Philips Electronics is facing legal action in the Federal Court over breathing devices it sold in Australia between 2019 and 2022.

title.children: Philips faces legal action over allegedly 'unsafe' breathing devices sold in Australia

image.altText: Elderly patient

props.synopsis: The biggest reforms to aged care in three decades have been delayed until November.

title.children: Aged care reforms delayed after sector raised survival issues

image.altText: Mondelez biscuit products compared with Aldi's products.

props.synopsis: It's not the first time Aldi has faced legal trouble over the packaging and branding of its products.

title.children: Oreo's maker is suing Aldi over packaging. Here's what's happening

image.altText: A man and a woman smile at each other during karaoke, against a neon backdrop.

props.synopsis: Blake Lively has withdrawn claims of emotional distress against her co-star Justin Baldoni after he demanded her medical records.

title.children: Blake Lively abandons two claims about co-star Justin Baldoni

image.altText: A man looks at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Australian stocks opened higher after Wall Street gained. Economic growth slowed more than forecast in the first quarter of the year.

title.children: ASX maintains gains as GDP misses forecasts — as it happened

image.altText: A court sketch of Eddy Garcia in the court room.

props.synopsis: A former hotel security guard says he was given $US100,000 in a brown paper bag by Sean "Diddy" Combs for what he hoped was the only video of him beating up his then-girlfriend Casandra Ventura in 2016.

title.children: Ex-hotel guard says Diddy paid him $US100,000 for video of assault

image.altText: An explosion coming from underwater with black smoke rising by  a bridge structure.

props.synopsis: Ukraine uses 1,100 kilograms of underwater explosives to attack the Kerch Bridge, which is a key supply route for Russian forces in Ukraine.

title.children: Ukraine hits bridge linking Russia and Crimea with underwater explosives

image.altText: A blonde teenager poses for a photo wearing a football jersey

props.synopsis: A Perth teenager who was behind the wheel in a road crash that killed young footballer Nick Campo is sentenced to more than three years in prison.

title.children: P-plater jailed for killing Nick Campo while speeding to nightclub

image.altText: Woman in white outfit.

props.synopsis: A teacher from a Lake Macquarie high school pleads not guilty to grooming and aggravated sexual intercourse with a teen in October 2024.

title.children: Teacher accused of sexually abusing 15yo boy to stand trial in Newcastle

image.altText: Sunia Turuva sits on the ground leaning back on his arms

props.synopsis: Sunia Turuva regrets mocking then-teammate Lachlan Galvin and says he patched things up with the youngster after his controversial Instagram post before Galvin left for the Bulldogs.

title.children: Tigers star says 'I've got to be the bigger person' after mocking Galvin

image.altText: Ceramic garden gnome with red hat and gnomes behind

props.synopsis: After fears he had fallen victim to a prank gone wrong, Gnobby the nude garden gnome — signed by featured artists at triple j's One Night Stand festival — is safely home.

title.children: Triple j caller reveals naked truth of gnome's mystery disappearance

image.altText: Two white parrots with yellow crests stand on a waist-high fence waiting for another to stop drinking from a fountain.

props.synopsis: The behaviour has spread among a mob of more than 100 sulphur-crested cockatoos that roost in the Western Sydney Parklands.

title.children: Clever cockies not only open bins, they can use water fountains too

image.altText: A woman with classes in a green suit.

props.synopsis: The Canberra Institute of Technology appoints a new chief executive, a year after Leanne Cover resigned and was found to have engaged in corrupt conduct in her handling of consultancy contracts.

title.children: CIT hires new CEO following corruption saga

image.altText: Alex Mills and two other men sitting near each other talking and smiling.

props.synopsis: Alex Mills has battled with stereotypes of what a man should be for years. He's now shedding light on toxic masculinity in a bid to get more men to think about the type of man they want to be and stamp out certain behaviours.

title.children: It's taken Alex decades to feel comfortable with the kind of man he is

image.altText: Hands holding on to a calculator and a pencil against a backdrop of receipts

props.synopsis: So how are you managing power bills this winter? Have you got tips or tricks to share? Tell us what has worked for you.

title.children: How are you saving on bills this winter? Share your tips

image.altText: Elon Musk wears a black baseball cap that says 'DOGE'.

props.synopsis: The Tesla entrepreneur says the "pork-filled" legislation the US president refers to as the "big, beautiful bill" is "outrageous".

title.children: Musk calls Trump's massive tax cuts bill a 'disgusting abomination'

image.altText: Mountainhead group

props.synopsis: While Jesse Armstrong gave the frequently abhorrent Roy family some nuance, the bumbling billionaire characters in his directorial debut are flat as a pancake.

title.children: Mountainhead is worse than doomscrolling Twitter for two hours

image.altText: A man with greying hair and a large bandage over his right ear emotionless in a police mugshot

props.synopsis: Federal agents are investigating "to what extent" Mohamed Sabry Soliman's family knew about the attack, and if they provided any support.

title.children: Colorado fire-bomb suspect's family being held for deportation

image.altText: A woman with sort hair is composited behind two men wearing glasses

props.synopsis: A recent US report on an abortion pill which experts have called "misinformation", "not scientific" and "scaremongering" has been cited in NSW Parliament by no less than 11 MPs across the spectrum.

title.children: 'Completely worthless': Flawed abortion pill 'study' cited in parliament

image.altText: A group of Indigenous dancers performing on a darkened stage, green and red lights in the background

props.synopsis: Mirning choreographer Frances Rings and Goolarrgon Bard artist Darrell Sibosado collaborate on Bangarra Dance Theatre's new production.

title.children: New Bangarra dance work is a 'glowing bridge between worlds'
